content.description:
Aeneas Sees a Snake

Dixerat haec, adytisadytum, -i, n.: shrine cum lubricuslubricus, -a, -um, adj.: slippery anguisanguis, -is, m.: snake ab imisimus, -a, -um, adj.: lowest 
septemseptem, adj. (indecl.): seven ingens gyrosgyrus, -i, m.: coil, septenasepteni, -ae, -a, adj.: seven (each) voluminavolumen, -inis, n.: coil traxit 
amplexus placideplacide, adv.: calmly tumulumtumulus, -i, m. = sepulcrum, -i lapsusque per aras.
content.question: How many elisions are in line 2 (septem...traxit)?

unit.text: 6: Course Project and Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry

skill.text: 2.A: Describe features and functions of stylistic elements in Latin texts.
